text.div:
MatchGrade

A Master Patient Index (MPI) assessment of whether a candidate patient record is a match or not.

This code system http://hl7.org/fhir/match-grade defines the following codes:

CodeDisplayDefinition
certain Certain MatchThis record meets the matching criteria to be automatically considered as a full match.
probable Probable MatchThis record is a close match, but not a certain match. Additional review (e.g. by a human) may be required before using this as a match.
possible Possible MatchThis record may be a matching one. Additional review (e.g. by a human) SHOULD be performed before using this as a match.
certainly-not Certainly Not a MatchThis record is known not to be a match. Note that usually non-matching records are not returned, but in some cases records previously or likely considered as a match may specifically be negated by the matching engine

name: MatchGrade
description: A Master Patient Index (MPI) assessment of whether a candidate patient record is a match or not.

concept.definition: This record meets the matching criteria to be automatically considered as a full match.
This record is a close match, but not a certain match. Additional review (e.g. by a human) may be required before using this as a match.
This record may be a matching one. Additional review (e.g. by a human) SHOULD be performed before using this as a match.

This record is known not to be a match. Note that usually non-matching records are not returned, but in some cases records previously or likely considered as a match may specifically be negated by the matching engine
